issue.title: update tooling, some fixes in types

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
fixes #10757

body:
I'm happy that webpack 5 has its own generated types. 

However I used these types from webpack (back when using `@types/webpack` 4), how to make this work with webpack 5 beta 15? All these types are now missing when installing the new package:

```ts
import webpack = require('webpack');

webpack.RuleSetRule

webpack.RuleSetLoader

webpack.Plugin

webpack.Output

webpack.Resolve

webpack.Options.Optimization

webpack.Stats.ToJsonOutput

webpack.loader.LoaderContext
```
@rvion Do you use `@types/webpack`? Because yes, webpack now provide own types

While we're at it, can we have a new publish of webpack-dev-server which accepts the webpack 5 generated types?

Let's say a version 4 beta of webpack-dev-server which depends on webpack 5 instead of `@types/webpack`, because this is also happening in my project:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8892187/80125071-59c9d700-85bb-11ea-9e4b-a3b4de685686.png)

**EDIT:** Actually no need to publish new `webpack-dev-server`, just new `@types/webpack-dev-server`

@evilebottnawi  Sorry, my response was a bit late.
I didn't notive sokra alrady pushed some changes when I replied 3 hours ago.
I was responding to your initial question here: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/10757#issuecomment-618500848

I don't know what is now missing on master after his recent commits, I switched back to using webpack 4 because of https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/9802#issuecomment-601911417 and don't have the time to check right now.

thanks anyway for the quick support !
@rvion Thanks for the link, WIP on this
